subject: Typing Quickscript with Keyman (edit)
msgSnippet: Hi Ewout and folks, I don t know whether anyone has tried using Ewout s keyboard map on the Tavultesoft Keyman program recently, but I did and (it s great,it s
messageBody:
Hi Ewout and folks,

I don't know whether anyone has tried using Ewout's
keyboard map on the Tavultesoft Keyman program
recently, but I did and (it's great,it's a much
faster, more intuitive way of typing quickscript,
but)I found I needed to make a couple of edits as
Tavultesoft have updated the program to version 6.0
now - free trial version available at
http://www.tavultesoft.com/keyman/. It mainly involves
adding some '+' symbols and updating the name of the
version.

Anyway, I edited the EFFCNT.KMN file that Ewout
provided as follows (I've included the previous
version at the end for ref). Might be just a system
thing for me - I'm not that technical,I'm just glad I
got it to work - but if anyone else has had problems,
these edits might help.

cheers,
Mike
....................................

NAME "Efficient Quickscript"

BITMAP qseon

HOTKEY "^+Q"

VERSION 6.0

begin > use(main)

group(main) using keys

'a' + 'a' > 'y'
'a' + 'u' > 'Q'
'a' + 'i' > 'F'

+'c' > 'A'
'A' + 'c' > 'c'

'i' + 'a' > 'W'

Effcnt.kmn


'j' + 'j' > 'J'
'j' + 'u' > 'V'

'k' + 'k' > 'ç'

'n' + 'n' > 'N'
'n' + 'k' > 'Nk'
'n' + 'g' > 'Ng'

'o' + 'o' > 'Y'
'o' + 'i' > 'q'
'o' + 'u' > 'O'

+'q' > 'E'

's' + 's' > 'S'

't' + 't' > 'T'

+'u' > 'M'
'M' + 'u' > 'U'

'w' + 'w' > '`'

+'x' > 'H'

+'y' >'I'

'z' + 'z' > 'Z'



previous version:

NAME "Efficient Quickscript"

BITMAPS qseon qseoff

HOTKEY "^+Q"

VERSION 3.0

begin > use(main)

group(main) using keys

'a' + 'a' > 'y'
'a' + 'u' > 'Q'
'a' + 'i' > 'F'

'c' > 'A'
'A' + 'c' > 'c'

'i' + 'a' > 'W'

'j' + 'j' > 'J'
'j' + 'u' > 'V'

'k' + 'k' > 'ç'

'n' + 'n' > 'N'
'n' + 'k' > 'Nk'
'n' + 'g' > 'Ng'

'o' + 'o' > 'Y'
'o' + 'i' > 'q'
'o' + 'u' > 'O'

'q' > 'E'

's' + 's' > 'S'

't' + 't' > 'T'

'u' > 'M'
'M' + 'u' > 'U'

'w' + 'w' > '`'

'x' > 'H'

'y' >'I'

'z' + 'z' > 'Z'
